info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 10 at 2:52PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM EDT FOR EAST CENTRAL FREDERICK AND CLARKE COUNTIES IN NORTHWESTERN VIRGINIA...JEFFERSON AND SOUTH CENTRAL BERKELEY COUNTIES IN THE PANHANDLE OF WEST VIRGINIA... At 251 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Inwood, or near Charles Town, and is drifting east. HAZARD...Localized 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Winchester, Charles Town, Ranson, Berryville, Inwood, Corporation Of Ranson, Middleway, Brucetown, Greenwood, Gaylord, Clear Brook, Ridgeway, Bunker Hill, Briggs, Halltown, Stephenson, Wickliffe, Wadesville, Summit Point and Cedar Hill. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
